intro: Lycium sokotranum, commonly known as the Sokotra gooseberry, is a shrub native to the Socotra archipelago. It belongs to the Solanaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, red berries. The plant has small, dark green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to the unique climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
